meanings.definition: Of the best quality or condition; first in importance
meanings.sent1: The cake was at its prime when it was fresh out of the oven.
meanings.sent2: She always wears her prime jewelry for special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The prime cupcakes disappeared within minutes at the party.
meanings.sent4: His prime skills in painting shone through in every stroke.
meanings.sent5: The prime sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A period of greatest strength, vigor, or success
meanings.sent1: During his prime, he could run faster than anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The company experienced its prime during the economic boom.
meanings.sent3: The prime of the movie was the thrilling car chase scene.
meanings.sent4: In the prime of summer, the flowers bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's prime was evident in his record-breaking performance.

meanings.definition: To prepare or make ready for a particular purpose
meanings.sent1: She had to prime the canvas before starting the painting.
meanings.sent2: They needed to prime the engine before starting the boat.
meanings.sent3: He decided to prime himself with a cup of coffee before the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to prime the ingredients before cooking the dish.
meanings.sent5: The team had to prime their strategy before the important game.

meanings.definition: To apply a coat of primer to (a surface)
meanings.sent1: He had to prime the walls before painting them a new color.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter needed to prime the wood before adding the final coat.
meanings.sent3: She carefully primed the metal surface before applying the paint.
meanings.sent4: The artist primed the canvas with a layer of white before starting the artwork.
meanings.sent5: Before painting the fence, they had to prime it to ensure the paint would stick.
